def_cn: （通常为故意地）伤害，危害
def_en: To harm a person or animal means to cause them physical injury, usually on purpose.

def_cn: （通常为故意的）伤害，危害
def_en: Harm is physical injury to a person or an animal which is usually caused on purpose.

def_cn: 破坏;损害;对…产生不利影响
def_en: To harm a thing, or sometimes a person, means to damage them or make them less effective or successful than they were.

def_cn: （某一行为造成的）损害，危害
def_en: Harm is the damage to something which is caused by a particular course of action.

def_cn: 不会受损害;不会受到伤害;会安然无恙
def_en: If you say that someone or something will come to no harm or that no harm will come to them, you mean that they will not be hurt or damaged in any way.

def_cn: 也许值得（做某事）;不妨（做某事）
def_en: If you say it does no harm to do something or there is no harm in doing something, you mean that it might be worth doing, and you will not be blamed for doing it.

def_cn: （做某事）没有坏处，有益;不妨（做某事）
def_en: If you say that something would do no harm, or do someone no harm, you are recommending a course of action which you think is worthwhile, helpful, or useful.

def_cn: 没有产生危害;没有人受到伤害
def_en: If you say that there is no harm done, you are telling someone not to worry about something that has happened because it has not caused any serious injury or damage.
If someone is put in harm's way, they are caused to be in a dangerous situation.

def_cn: 在安全的地方;没有危险
def_en: If someone or something is out of harm's way, they are in a safe place away from danger or from the possibility of being damaged.
